issue.title: [C++][Compute] Sketch a C++ consumer of compute IR
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-14074](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-14074). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
ARROW-14062 adds a basic compute Intermediate Representation. Allowing c++ compute to consume this and produce ExecPlans will allow more straightforward and less tightly coupled usage of ExecPlans from bindings.

comments.body:
***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-14074?focusedCommentId=17439412) by Ben Kietzman (bkietz):*
Issue resolved by pull request 11384
<https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/11384>

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-14074?focusedCommentId=17565067) by Joris Van den Bossche (jorisvandenbossche):*
Given that we are planning to remove the Compute IR consumer (ARROW-16740, since we now use Substrait instead), I think all those sub-tasks can be closed. 
Or is there anything that is still useful / can be repurposed for the Substrait-based consumer APIs? (I suppose those already have its own JIRAs)

cc `[~westonpace]`
